chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert M Dix Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants 94 days credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: 14CM1193

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling that is recommended.
Submit to a Mental Health assessment.

Cooperate fully with any treatment recommended.
Adhere to any medications regime and be monitored by Agent.
No contact with person associated with 14CF837 including Jeff H. whatsoever.
No violent contact with anyone.
Defendant to reside with his parents unless they find the condition intolerable or unlivable.
Defendant to submit to Anger Management program and any treatment/counseling.

If parties cannot reach an agreement on restitution, a restitution hearing is scheduled for 12/08/2014 at 2:30pm.

AMENDED ON 12/08/2014: Restitution as follows: $4,181.81 (total) $3,082.47 to City of New Berlin in 14CM1193, and $1,099.34 to Jeffrey H., in 14CF837. To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert M Dix not in court. Attorney Reisha Mitchell in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a stipulation as to the restitution in file 14CF837. Court approves stipulation. Restitution is set at $4181.81 - $3082.47 to City of New Berlin and $1099.34 to Jeffrey H. in file 14CF837.  Amended JOC to be prepared.
Dated 12/5/14 filed by Attorney Mitchell advising the Court the parties have reached an agreement regarding restitution.
Restitution hearing on December 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
2 statements filed by the State
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert M Dix in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Mitchell.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information and read-in list filed by the State.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  Withheld sentence STAYED 2 year Probation - concurrent - 94 days credit if revoked
- Court Costs of $253.00 (includes DRGOD)to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 4 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment/counseling - cooperate fully with any treatment. Mental Health assessment - defendant to cooperate fully. Adhere to any medication regime and be monitored by Agent. No contact with persons associated with 14CF837 including Jeff H. whatsoever. No violent contact with anyone whatsoever. Defendant to reside with his parents unless they find the condition intolerable or unliveable. Defendant to submit to anger management program and any treatment/counseling. Defendant to pay restitution - if parties can not reach an agreement a restitution hearing to be set (counsels now request a restitution hearing).  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
filed by the State
